<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===- ConstantRange.h - Represent a range ----------------------&#42;- C++ -&#42;-===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Represent a range of possible values that may occur when the program is run</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for an integral value.  This keeps track of a lower and upper bound for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// constant, which MAY wrap around the end of the numeric range.  To do this, it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// keeps track of a &#91;lower, upper) bound, which specifies an interval just like</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// STL iterators.  When used with boolean values, the following are important</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ranges: :</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#91;F, F) = &#123;&#125;     = Empty set</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#91;T, F) = &#123;T&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#91;F, T) = &#123;F&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#91;T, T) = &#123;F, T&#125; = Full set</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The other integral ranges use min/max values for special range values. For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// example, for 8-bit types, it uses:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#91;0, 0)     = &#123;&#125;       = Empty set</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#91;255, 255) = &#123;0..255&#125; = Full Set</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note that ConstantRange can be used to represent either signed or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// unsigned ranges.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Produce the smallest range such that all values that may satisfy the given</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// predicate with any value contained within Other is contained in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// returned range.  Formally, this returns a superset of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#39;union over all y in Other . &#123; x : icmp op x y is true &#125;&#39;.  If the exact</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Produce the largest range such that all values in the returned range</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// satisfy the given predicate with all values contained within Other.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Formally, this returns a subset of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#39;intersection over all y in Other . &#123; x : icmp op x y is true &#125;&#39;.  If the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// exact answer is not representable as a ConstantRange, the return value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// will be a proper subset of the above.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Example: Pred = ult and Other = i8 &#91;2, 5) returns &#91;0, 2)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  &#42; Full set: Not wrapped.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If represented precisely, the result of some range operations may consist</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of multiple disjoint ranges. As only a single range may be returned, any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// range covering these disjoint ranges constitutes a valid result, but some</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// may be more useful than others depending on context. The preferred range</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// type specifies whether a range that is non-wrapping in the unsigned or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// signed domain, or has the smallest size, is preferred. If a signedness is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// preferred but all ranges are non-wrapping or all wrapping, then the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// smallest set size is preferred. If there are multiple smallest sets, any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// one of them may be returned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082">PreferredRangeType</a> &#123; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082a25a373cd66e09df5cb7b8cf3f443ea2b">Smallest</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082ade1662f5186fd8852b4dcce8eb6563bc">Unsigned</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange/#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082a8260f3d302e2463fd93753dfd0de6ec1">Signed</a> &#125;;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return a new range representing the possible values resulting</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// from an application of the specified cast operator to this range. \\p</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// BitWidth is the target bitwidth of the cast.  For casts which don&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// change bitwidth, it must be the same as the source bitwidth.  For casts</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// which do change bitwidth, the bitwidth must be consistent with the</span></CodeLine>
